\hypertarget{brief-description-of-the-project}{%
\subsection{\texorpdfstring{\textbf{Brief Description of the
Project}}{Brief Description of the Project}}\label{brief-description-of-the-project}}

DESCRIPTION

Comcast is an American global telecommunication company. The firm has
been providing terrible customer service. They continue to fall short
despite repeated promises to improve. Only last month (October 2016) the
authority fined them a \$2.3 million, after receiving over 1000 consumer
complaints.

The existing database will serve as a repository of public customer
complaints filed against Comcast. It will help to pin down what is wrong
with Comcast's customer service.

Data Dictionary

1.Ticket : Ticket number assigned to each complaint

2.Customer Complaint: Description of complaint

3.Date: Date of complaint

4.Time: Time of complaint

5.Received Via: Mode of communication of the complaint

6.City: Customer city

7.State: Customer state

8.Zipcode: Customer zip

9.Status: Status of complaint

10.Filing on behalf of someone

Since attribute Date is not in a single format(4/08/2015 and
26-05-2015), it is required to present the Date Column in one single
format for better understanding.

\textbf{formatting date}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{date_format1 <-}\KeywordTok{strptime}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date, }\DataTypeTok{format =} \StringTok{"%d-%m-%Y"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{date_format2 <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{strptime}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date, }\DataTypeTok{format =} \StringTok{"%d/%m/%Y"}\NormalTok{ )}
\NormalTok{date_format1[}\KeywordTok{is.na}\NormalTok{(date_format1)] <-}\StringTok{ }\NormalTok{date_format2[}\OperatorTok{!}\KeywordTok{is.na}\NormalTok{(date_format2)]}
\NormalTok{date_format1 <-}\KeywordTok{as.Date}\NormalTok{(date_format1)}

\NormalTok{telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date <-}\StringTok{ }\NormalTok{date_format1}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{months <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{format}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date, }\StringTok{"%m"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{data=}\KeywordTok{data.frame}\NormalTok{(}\KeywordTok{table}\NormalTok{(months))}

\NormalTok{monthlytrend <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{ggplot}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{data=}\NormalTok{data , }\KeywordTok{aes}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{x=}\NormalTok{months, }\DataTypeTok{y=}\NormalTok{Freq, }\DataTypeTok{group=}\DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{))}\OperatorTok{+}
\StringTok{  }\KeywordTok{geom_path}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{color =} \StringTok{"red"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}
\StringTok{  }\KeywordTok{ggtitle}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Monthly Trend Of Customer Complaints"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{geom_point}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{size=}\DecValTok{2}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{shape=}\DecValTok{22}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{fill=}\StringTok{"black"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{geom_area}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{color=}\StringTok{"red"}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{fill=}\StringTok{"cornflowerblue"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{xlab}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Months of the Year"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}
\StringTok{  }\KeywordTok{ylab}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"No of Complaints"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{monthlytrend     }
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\includegraphics{Project2_files/figure-latex/unnamed-chunk-4-1.pdf}

According to Monthly Trend Of Customer Complaints Graph, maximum
complaints were received in the months April, May and June. The
financial year starts from April and alot of pending works are completed
during this period and hence more utilization of Network bandwidth so we
can infer that this could be the reason of maximum complaints registered
during this period.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{day <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{format}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date, }\StringTok{"%a"}\NormalTok{)}
\KeywordTok{table}\NormalTok{(day)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## day
## Fri Mon Sat Sun Thu Tue Wed 
## 290 256 214 228 331 464 441
\end{verbatim}

There is one more trend which can be noted here i.e, most of the
complaints are registered on Tuesday and Wednesday and least on Saturday
which is the family day of the week. Howsoever the trend is not so
prominent.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{date <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{format}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Date, }\StringTok{"%d"}\NormalTok{)}

\StringTok{  }\KeywordTok{ggtitle}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Day Wise Trend Of Customer Complaints"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{geom_point}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{size=}\DecValTok{2}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{shape=}\DecValTok{22}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{fill=}\StringTok{"black"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{geom_area}\NormalTok{(}\DataTypeTok{color=}\StringTok{"red"}\NormalTok{, }\DataTypeTok{fill=}\StringTok{"cornflowerblue"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}\KeywordTok{xlab}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Days Of The Month"}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{+}

\hypertarget{objective3provide-a-table-with-the-frequency-of-complaint-types}{%
\subsection{\texorpdfstring{\textbf{Objective3:Provide a table with the
frequency of complaint
types}}{Objective3:Provide a table with the frequency of complaint types}}\label{objective3provide-a-table-with-the-frequency-of-complaint-types}}

It is very important to figure out the major issues for which the
complaints are being registered in order to improve Comcast Overall
Performance and Market Image.

The registered complaints are not divided in specific categories
howsoever the nature of the Customer.Complaint column is available in
Random, i.e for the service issue the registered complaints are
``Throttling service and unreasonable data caps'',``Horrible Internet
Service'',``Comcast not working and no service to boot'' etc. It is
required to divide Complaints in major categories like Service, Internet
and Billing. There could be other categories as well howsoever majority
of the complaints are registered around these issues.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{Service_Issue <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{grep}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"ervice"}\NormalTok{, telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Customer.Complaint, }\DataTypeTok{ignore.case =} \OtherTok{FALSE}\NormalTok{) }
\NormalTok{Internet_Issue <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{grep}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"net"}\NormalTok{, telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Customer.Complaint, }\DataTypeTok{ignore.case =} \OtherTok{FALSE}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{Overbilling_Issue <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{grep}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"bill"}\NormalTok{, telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Customer.Complaint,}\DataTypeTok{ignore.case =} \OtherTok{FALSE}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{complaint_types <-}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{c}\NormalTok{(}\KeywordTok{length}\NormalTok{(Service_Issue), }\KeywordTok{length}\NormalTok{(Internet_Issue), }\KeywordTok{length}\NormalTok{(Overbilling_Issue))}
\KeywordTok{table}\NormalTok{(complaint_types)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## complaint_types
## 184 482 534 
##   1   1   1
\end{verbatim}

Here 1200 of the total complaints belong to 3 categories i.e,Service,
Internet and Billing.

Pending is to be categorized as Open and Closed \& Solved is to be

\NormalTok{telecom[telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Status}\OperatorTok{==}\StringTok{"Solved"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"Status"}\NormalTok{] <-}\StringTok{ "Closed"}
\NormalTok{telecom[telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Status}\OperatorTok{==}\StringTok{"Pending"}\NormalTok{ ,}\StringTok{"Status"}\NormalTok{ ] <-}\StringTok{ "Open"}
\NormalTok{Status.State <-}\KeywordTok{table}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{Status, telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{State)}
\NormalTok{Status.State}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{m<-}\KeywordTok{data.frame}\NormalTok{(}\KeywordTok{table}\NormalTok{(telecom}\OperatorTok{$}\NormalTok{State))}
\NormalTok{m1<-m }\OperatorTok{%>%}\StringTok{ }\KeywordTok{filter}\NormalTok{(Freq}\OperatorTok{>}\DecValTok{80}\NormalTok{)}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
